Posts.Content: Metster-Mom wrote: Hello, Even as I sit here typing I can't believe this is my life. Three years ago at the age of 35 I was diagnosed with IDC, Stage 3A. I did everything I was supposed to do - even tried to do it with a smile. Now three years later, and I was just diagnosed with mets to my lower sacrum. I will have my ovaries out this week and will then start Ibrance and Letrezole 2 weeks later. I, of course, am a mix of emotions. I have a 9 year old son who I want to watch grow up so I don't plan on going anywhere! The weird part is that other than a little lower back pain, I don't feel sick at all. My blood counts are normal and I feel great. Has anyone else felt like this at the time of diagnosis? I'm on here hoping to find stories of positivity, strength and HOPE! Cancer really sucks. Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed Metster-Mom Partyoffive

Posts.Content: Metster-Mom wrote: I have started a few posts but hesitated to start this one. There is a lot of research that shows a correlation between wine and breast cancer. (other cancers, too) I love my wine and definitely cut back after my original diagnosis. My question is for wine drinkers. (or any alcohol) Are you still drinking? If so, how much? I just want to be able to enjoy a few glasses and not feel bad about it. I am newly diagnosed with Mets to my sacrum so I'm trying to process this all. (which makes me want to have a glass of wine even more - ha!) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Wine Metster-Mom Daywalker

Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2017 10:21AM - edited Aug 12, 2017 10:22AM by Metster-Mom I'm with you on being able to enjoy wine. I agree moderation and I also think having a little more on the weekend is fine. We have to live, right? I am not really drinking during the week, unless I have a social event. On the weekends I like to hang out with my husband and kick back with a few glasses of wine. I'm newly diagnosed and very overwhelmed and full of emotion.I need some normalcy! ❤️
